verses.text: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

verses.text: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:
But when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and overcome him, he taketh from him all his armour wherein he trusted, and divideth his spoils.

similars.text: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
Gad, a troop shall overcome him: but he shall overcome at the last.

verses.text: He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

similars.text: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
Whosoever declareth more or less than this, the same is not of me, but is against me; therefore he is not of my church.
He is near that justifieth me; who will contend with me? let us stand together: who is mine adversary? let him come near to me.
Behold, they shall surely gather together against thee, not by me; whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake.
Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
And Jesus said unto him, Forbid him not: for he that is not against us is for us.
For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Lord.
Behold, they shall surely gather together, but not by me: whosoever shall gather together against thee shall fall for thy sake.
And he that doeth not these things is not my disciple; by this you may know my disciples.
Do not I hate them, O Lord, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?
Behold, I am against thee, O thou most proud, saith the Lord God of hosts: for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.

verses.text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out.

similars.text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.
Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.

When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.

verses.text: And when he cometh, he findeth it swept and garnished.

similars.text: Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.

verses.text: Then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirits more wicked than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first.

similars.text: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.

And then shall it come to pass, that the spirits of the wicked, yea, who are evil--for behold, they have no part nor portion of the Spirit of the Lord; for behold, they chose evil works rather than good; therefore the spirit of the devil did enter into them, and take possession of their house--and these shall be cast out into outer darkness; there shall be weeping, and wailing, and gnashing of teeth, and this because of their own iniquity, being led captive by the will of the devil.

Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation.

verses.text: And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.

similars.text: And she spake out with a loud voice, and said, Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.
For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.

verses.text: But he said, Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.

similars.text: Blessed is he that readeth, and they that hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things which are written therein: for the time is at hand.
So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
And he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.
Therefore, ye shepherds, hear the word of the Lord;
Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and that seek him with the whole heart.
Therefore, blessed are they who will repent and hearken unto the voice of the Lord their God; for these are they that shall be saved.
Therefore, O ye shepherds, hear the word of the Lord;
That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the Lord.
He who hath faith to hear shall hear.
Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

verses.text: And when the people were gathered thick together, he began to say, This is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no sign be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.

verses.text: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, putteth it in a secret place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which come in may see the light.

similars.text: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed; but setteth it on a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.

verses.text: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when thine eye is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.

verses.text: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.

similars.text: For behold, my beloved brethren, I say unto you that the Lord God worketh not in darkness.
The light shineth in darkness, and the darkness comprehendeth it not; nevertheless, the day shall come when you shall comprehend even God, being quickened in him and by him.
Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
I am the light which shineth in darkness, and the darkness comprehendeth it not.
The light and the life of the world, a light which shineth in darkness and the darkness comprehendeth it not;
The light and the life of the world; a light which shineth in darkness and the darkness comprehendeth it not;

Therefore night shall be unto you, that ye shall not have a vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and the sun shall go down over the prophets, and the day shall be dark over them.
Take heed to thyself that thou forsake not the Levite as long as thou livest upon the earth.
But it shall be one day which shall be known to the Lord, not day, nor night: but it shall come to pass, that at evening time it shall be light.
The sun shall be no more thy light by day; neither for brightness shall the moon give light unto thee: but the Lord shall be unto thee an everlasting light, and thy God thy glory.
I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.
Take heed to thyself that thou offer not thy burnt offerings in every place that thou seest:

And now, my brethren, seeing that ye know the light by which ye may judge, which light is the light of Christ, see that ye do not judge wrongfully; for with that same judgment which ye judge ye shall also be judged.
Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall arise; when I sit in darkness, the Lord shall be a light unto me.
Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?
And it shall come to pass in that day, that the light shall not be clear, nor dark:
If thy whole body therefore be full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light.
And that which doth not edify is not of God, and is darkness.
But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If, therefore, the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!
But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!

O then, is not this real? I say unto you, Yea, because it is light; and whatsoever is light, is good, because it is discernible, therefore ye must know that it is good; and now behold, after ye have tasted this light is your knowledge perfect?
Therefore, gird up your loins, that you may be the children of light, and that day shall not overtake you as a thief.

verses.text: And as he spake, a certain Pharisee besought him to dine with him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.

similars.text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee's house, and sat down to meat.

And when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these things, he said unto him, Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.
And it came to pass, as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples.
And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?
And it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.

verses.text: And when the Pharisee saw it, he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.
And the Lord said unto him, Now do ye Pharisees make clean the outside of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of ravening and wickedness.

similars.text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.
Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.
Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.

verses.text: Ye fools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?
But rather give alms of such things as ye have; and, behold, all things are clean unto you.

similars.text: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.
Verily I say unto you, ye are clean, but not all; and there is none else with whom I am well pleased;

Verily I say unto you, my servant William, that you are clean, but not all; repent, therefore, of those things which are not pleasing in my sight, saith the Lord, for the Lord will show them unto you.
And let all things be done in cleanliness before me.
For thou hast said, My doctrine is pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.
Behold, your sins are forgiven you; you are clean before me; therefore, lift up your heads and rejoice.
Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you, and ye shall be clean: from all your filthiness, and from all your idols, will I cleanse you.

verses.text: But woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye tithe mint and rue and all manner of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of God: these ought ye to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

verses.text: Then answered one of the lawyers, and said unto him, Master, thus saying thou reproachest us also.
And he said, Woe unto you also, ye lawyers! for ye lade men with burdens grievous to be borne, and ye yourselves touch not the burdens with one of your fingers.

similars.text: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay them on men's shoulders; but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.

verses.text: Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

similars.text: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.

Woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did their fathers to the false prophets.

Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous,
Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.

verses.text: Truly ye bear witness that ye allow the deeds of your fathers: for they indeed killed them, and ye build their sepulchres.

similars.text: Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.
And be not ye like your fathers, and like your brethren, which trespassed against the Lord God of their fathers, who therefore gave them up to desolation, as ye see.

Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the Lord, which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.

And now behold, I say unto you, my brethren, you that belong to this church, have you sufficiently retained in remembrance the captivity of your fathers? Yea, and have you sufficiently retained in remembrance his mercy and long-suffering towards them? And moreover, have ye sufficiently retained in remembrance that he has delivered their souls from hell?
Woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

verses.text: Therefore also said the wisdom of God, I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they shall slay and persecute:

similars.text: Wherefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: and some of them ye shall kill and crucify; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute them from city to city:

For behold, thus saith the Lord God: I will give unto the children of men line upon line, precept upon precept, here a little and there a little; and blessed are those who hearken unto my precepts, and lend an ear unto my counsel, for they shall learn wisdom; for unto him that receiveth I will give more; and from them that shall say, We have enough, from them shall be taken away even that which they have.

Wherefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: and some of them ye shall kill and crucify; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute them from city to city:

verses.text: That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

similars.text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.
For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink; for they are worthy.
From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.

verses.text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, which perished between the altar and the temple: verily I say unto you, It shall be required of this generation.

similars.text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.
That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;
The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.
Saying, This is the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.
And he said unto them, This is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.

And thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be hallowed, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him.
That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.

That the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

verses.text: Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.
And as he said these things unto them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to urge him vehemently, and to provoke him to speak of many things:

similars.text: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.
And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,
And it came to pass as he began to expound these things unto them they were angry with him, and began to mock him; and they would not hear the words which he spake.
And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in his words.
And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might entangle him in his talk.

verses.text: Laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.
